results.title: The Role of Lisinopril and Bisoprolol to Prevent Anthracycline Induced Cardiotoxicity in Locally Advanced Breast Cancer Patients
results.text_hl: The Role of @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@Lisinopril@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Bisoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017298 @@@Bisoprolol@@@ to Prevent @CHEMICAL_Anthracyclines @CHEMICAL_MESH:D018943 @@@Anthracycline@@@ Induced @DISEASE_Cardiotoxicity @DISEASE_MESH:D066126 @@@Cardiotoxicity@@@ in Locally Advanced @<m>DISEASE_Breast_Neoplasms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001943 @@@Breast Cancer@@@ Patients

results.title: Exemestane-Everolimus-Induced Angioedema in a Woman With Metastatic Breast Cancer: A Case Report and Review
results.text_hl: Herein, we report the management of a 71-year-old female with metastatic @<m>DISEASE_Breast_Neoplasms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001943 @@@breast cancer@@@ who developed acute @DISEASE_Angioedema @DISEASE_MESH:D000799 @@@angioedema@@@ following the simultaneous use of @CHEMICAL_exemestane @CHEMICAL_MESH:C056516 @@@exemestane@@@-@CHEMICAL_Everolimus @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068338 @@@everolimus@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@.

citations.NLM: Grabie YY, Ahmed A, Acharya S, Flamenbaum MH. Exemestane-Everolimus-Induced Angioedema in a Woman With Metastatic Breast Cancer: A Case Report and Review Cureus. 2023 Nov;15(11):e48628. PMID: 38084165
